sentences.text: March 20, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dear Stockholder:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are cordially invited to attend the 2017 annual meeting of stockholders (the Annual Meeting) of Essex Property Trust, Inc., a Maryland corporation (the Company), to be held at the Garden Court Hotel, 520 Cowper Street, Palo Alto, California, 94301, on May 16, 2017, at 1:00 p.m., Pacific Time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The attached notice of annual meeting and proxy statement describe the matters expected to be acted upon at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We urge you to review these materials carefully.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This year we are again furnishing proxy materials to our stockholders over the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On or about March 29, 2017, we are mailing to most of our stockholders a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials containing instructions on how to access our notice of annual meeting, proxy statement, and 2016 Annual Report to Stockholders and how to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some stockholders may, if they have so previously requested, receive these materials via email or paper copies by mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you only received a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials by mail, the notice of annual meeting also contains instructions on how you can receive a paper copy of the proxy materials and 2016 Annual Report.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please use this opportunity to take part in the Companys affairs by voting on the business to be presented at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether or not you plan to attend the meeting in person, please authorize your proxy via the Internet prior to 11:59 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Time, on May 15, 2017, or if you are receiving a paper copy of the proxy statement, by telephone or by completing, signing, dating and eturning a proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Authorizing your proxy over the Internet, by telephone or by mailing a proxy card will ensure that your shares are represented at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please review the instructions contained in the Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials egarding each of these options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you attend the Annual Meeting, you may vote in person, even if you have previously mailed your proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote is important to us and we appreciate your continued support of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Michael J. Schall Chief Executive Officer and President
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notice of Annual Meeting of Stockholders To Be Held May 16, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 annual meeting of stockholders (the Annual Meeting) of Essex Property Trust, Inc., a Maryland corporation (the Company), will be held at the Garden Court Hotel, 520 Cowper Street, Palo Alto, California, 94301, on May 16, 2017 at 1:00 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pacific Time, for the following purposes:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. To consider and vote upon the election of the following nominees to serve as directors until the 2018 annual meeting and until their respective successors are duly elected and qualified: Keith R. Guericke, Irving F. Lyons, III, George M. Marcus, Gary P. Martin, Issie N. Rabinovitch, Thomas E. Robinson, Michael J. Schall, Byron A. Scordelis, and Janice L. Sears.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. To consider and vote upon the ratification of the appointment of KPMG LLP as the independent registered public accounting firm for the Company for the year ending December 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. To consider and vote upon an advisory vote to approve the Companys named executive officer compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. To consider and vote upon an advisory vote to determine the frequency of named executive officer compensation advisory votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5. To transact such other business as may properly come before the Annual Meeting or any postponement or adjournment thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The foregoing items of business, including the nominees for directors, are more fully described in the attached proxy statement, which forms a part of this notice and is incorporated herein by reference.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are encouraged to read the proxy statement in its entirety before voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has fixed the close of business on February 28, 2017, as the record date for determining the stockholders entitled to notice of and to vote at the Annual Meeting or any postponement or adjournment thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote is important.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether or not you expect to attend the Annual Meeting in person, we urge you to submit your proxy and vote as promptly as possible to ensure your representation and the presence of a quorum at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may authorize a proxy to vote your shares via the Internet until 11:59 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Time, on May 15, 2017, or, if you have received and/or requested a paper copy of our proxy materials, by telephone or by mail, by completing, signing, dating and returning the proxy card in the envelope provided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you attend the Annual Meeting in person, you may continue to have your shares voted as instructed on your proxy or you may withdraw your proxy at our Annual Meeting and vote your shares in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your proxy is revocable in accordance with the procedures set forth in the proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By Order of the Board of Directors and on behalf of the Secretary of the Company,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Michael J. Schall Chief Executive Officer and President San Mateo, California March 20, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: INFORMATION CONCERNING SOLICITATION AND VOTING
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proxy statement is furnished to the holders of the outstanding shares of common stock, $0.0001 par value (the Common Stock) of Essex Property Trust, Inc., a Maryland corporation (the Company or Essex), in connection with the solicitation by the Companys Board of Directors (the Board) of proxies in the accompanying form for use in voting at the 2017 annual meeting of stockholders of the Company (the Annual Meeting) to be held on May 16, 2017 at 1:00 p.m., Pacific Time, at the Garden Court Hotel, 520 Cowper Street, Palo Alto, California, 94301, and any postponement or adjournment thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proxy statement and the accompanying notice of annual meeting, proxy card and 2016 Annual Report to Stockholders are first being made available to stockholders on or about March 29, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Important Notice Regarding the Availability of Proxy Materials for the Stockholder Meeting to Be Held on May 16, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proxy statement, notice of annual meeting, proxy card, and 2016 Annual Report to Stockholders are available electronically at http://materials.proxyvote.com/297178.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directions to the meeting location can be found at http://www.essex.com under Investors; Shareholder Services and Information-Annual Shareholders Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission (the SEC), we have elected to provide access to our proxy materials over the Internet, instead of mailing paper copies to each stockholder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, on or about March 29, 2017, we are mailing to many of our stockholders a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (Notice), while brokers and other nominees who hold shares on behalf of beneficial owners will be sending their own similar notice, containing instructions on how to access our proxy materials and 2016 Annual Report to Stockholders and how to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice is not itself a proxy and cannot itself be used to vote your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received only a Notice this year, you will not receive paper copies of the proxy materials unless you request the materials by following the instructions on the Notice or on the website referred to in the Notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some stockholders may, if they have so requested previously, receive these materials via email or receive paper copies by mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who Can Vote
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are entitled to vote if you were a holder of record of Common Stock as of the close of business on February 28, 2017 (the Record Date).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your shares can be voted at the Annual Meeting only if you are present in person or represented by a valid proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting Procedures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders of record as of the Record Date are entitled to one vote for each share of Common Stock held on all matters to be voted upon at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please note, however, that if your shares are held of record by a broker, bank or other nominee and you wish to vote in person at the meeting, you must obtain a proxy issued in your name from such broker, bank or other nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you choose not to attend the Annual Meeting, you may still authorize your proxy via the Internet or by telephone until 11:59 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Time, on May 15, 2017, or by completing, signing, dating and returning a proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The presence at the Annual Meeting, either in person or by proxy, of stockholders holding a majority of the shares of Common Stock outstanding on the Record Date will constitute a quorum for purposes of the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each share of Common Stock outstanding on the Record Date is entitled to one vote on each proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the Record Date, there were 65,558,037 shares of Common Stock outstanding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are held in the name of a broker, you should receive a voting instruction form from your broker.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your broker will vote your shares in the manner you timely indicate pursuant to the voting instruction form.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TABLE OF CONTENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: do not timely indicate your voting instructions to your broker, the broker will not be permitted to vote your shares at the Annual Meeting on Proposal No. 1 (election of directors), Proposal No. 3 (advisory vote to approve the Companys named executive officer compensation) or Proposal No. 4 (advisory vote on the frequency of named executive officer compensation advisory votes) because such proposals are not routine matters under the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, your broker may in its discretion vote your shares on Proposal No. 2 (ratification of KPMG LLP) if you do not timely indicate voting instructions on that proposal because the proposal is a routine matter under the NYSE rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Counting of Votes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares of Common Stock represented by proxies that reflect abstentions or broker non-votes (i.e., shares held by a broker or nominee which are represented at the Annual Meeting, but with respect to which such broker or nominee chooses not to exercise or does not have discretionary authority to vote the shares on a particular matter because the matter is not routine under the NYSE rules) will be counted as shares that are present for purposes of determining the presence of a quorum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to Proposal No. 1 (election of directors), our Sixth Amended and Restated Bylaws (the Bylaws) include a majority voting standard for the election of directors in uncontested elections, which are generally defined as elections in which the number of nominees does not exceed the number of directors to be elected at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the election of directors, you may either vote FOR or WITHHOLD as to each nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cumulative voting is not permitted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the majority voting standard, in uncontested elections of directors such as this election, each director must be elected by the affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast by the holders of shares present in person or represented by proxy and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A majority of the votes cast means that the number of votes cast FOR a candidate for director exceeds the number of votes WITHHELD as to that candidate for director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Brokers do not have discretionary authority to vote for directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions and broker non-votes, if any, will not count as a vote cast FOR or WITHHELD as to a nominees election and thus will have no effect in determining whether a director nominee has received a majority of the votes cast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with our Bylaws, in this election, an incumbent candidate for director who does not receive the required votes for re-election is expected to offer his or her resignation to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee of the Board will then make a determination as to whether to accept or reject the tendered resignation and will submit such recommendation for consideration by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally within 90 days after certification of the election results of the stockholder vote, we will publicly disclose the decision regarding any tendered resignation in a filing of a Current Report on Form 8-K with the SEC or by other public announcement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a directors offer to resign is not accepted by the Board, such director will continue to serve until his or her successor is duly elected, or his or her earlier death, resignation, retirement or removal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approval of each of Proposals No. 2 (ratification of KPMG LLP) and No. 3 (advisory vote to approve the Companys named executive officer compensation) requires the affirmative vote of a majority of all the votes cast on the matter at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of the votes on Proposals No. 2 and No. 3, abstentions and broker non-votes will not be counted as votes cast and will have no effect on the result of the vote on such proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 4 (advisory vote on the frequency of named executive officer compensation advisory votes) allows our stockholders to select from the following alternatives (as required under SEC rules): 1 year, 2 years, 3 years or abstain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The affirmative vote of a majority of all the votes cast on the matter at the Annual Meeting is required to approve one of the selections under this advisory proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If none of the frequency alternatives (1 year, 2 years or 3 years) receives a majority of the votes cast, we will consider the highest number of votes cast by stockholders to be the frequency that has been selected by our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions or broker non- votes on this proposal will not affect the outcome of the vote on the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder votes will be tabulated by the persons appointed by the Board to act as inspectors of election for the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The shares of Common Stock represented by properly executed proxy cards will be voted at the Annual Meeting as indicated or, if no instruction is given on a properly executed proxy card, in accordance with the recommendation of the Board, as set forth below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Recommendations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends that stockholders vote:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the election of the Boards nominees named herein;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TABLE OF CONTENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the ratification of the appointment of KPMG LLP as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm for the year ending December 31, 2017;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the approval, on an advisory basis, of the Companys named executive officer compensation; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: for the approval, on an advisory basis, of the frequency of future stockholder advisory votes every 1 YEA
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not presently know of any other business which may come before the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No person is authorized to make any representation with respect to the matters described in this proxy statement other than those contained herein and, if given or made, such information or representation must not be relied upon as having been authorized by us or any other person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revocability of Proxies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any proxy given pursuant to this solicitation may be revoked by the person giving it at any time before it is exercised by delivering to the Company, to the attention of Mr. Jordan E. Ritter, Corporate Secretary, Essex Property Trust, Inc., 1100 Park Place, Suite 200, San Mateo, California 94403, a written notice of revocation or a properly executed proxy bearing a later date, or by attending the Annual Meeting and voting in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attendance at the Annual Meeting will not by itself revoke a proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Solicitation of Proxies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company will bear all costs of soliciting proxies for the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These costs include the expense of preparing and furnishing proxy materials for the Annual Meeting and reimbursements paid to brokerage firms and others for their expenses incurred in forwarding solicitation material regarding the Annual Meeting to stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company may conduct solicitation of proxies personally, telephonically or by facsimile through its officers, directors and regular employees, none of whom will receive additional compensation for assisting with the solicitation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Email Access to Proxy Materials
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders who previously elected to receive the proxy statement and the 2016 Annual Report to Stockholders over the Internet will be receiving an email on or about March 29, 2017, with information on how to access stockholder information and instructions for authorizing a proxy over the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders of record wishing to receive future stockholder materials via email may elect this option by following the instructions provided when voting over the Internet at http://www.ProxyVote.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon electing to view future proxy statements and annual reports over the Internet, stockholders will receive an email notification next year with instructions containing the Internet address of those materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The choice to view future proxy statements and annual reports over the Internet will remain in effect until the stockholder contacts their broker or the Company to rescind such instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Internet access does not have to be elected each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders who elected to receive the proxy statement electronically over the Internet and who would now like to receive a paper copy of the proxy statement so that they may submit a paper proxy in lieu of an electronic proxy, should contact either their broker or the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Householding of Annual Meeting Materials
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some brokers and other nominee record holders may be participating in the practice of householding Notices of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials or proxy statements and annual reports, as applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This means that only one copy of the Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials or proxy statement and annual report may have been sent to multiple stockholders in a stockholders household.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company will promptly deliver a separate copy of each applicable document to any stockholder who contacts the Companys investor relations department by written or oral request at our address on page 1 of this proxy statement or by telephone at (650) 655-7800 requesting such copies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a stockholder is receiving multiple copies at the stockholders household and would like to receive a single copy for a stockholders household in the future, stockholders should contact their broker, other nominee record holder, or the Companys investor relations department to request mailing of a single copy of the applicable document.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such shares, however, are not deemed outstanding for the purposes of computing the percentage ownership of each other person.

sentences.text: ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the Annual Meeting, the following individuals are each nominated for election as directors to serve until the annual meeting of stockholders in 2018 and until their successors are duly elected and qualified: Keith R. Guericke, Irving F. Lyons, III, George M. Marcus, Gary P. Martin, Issie N. Rabinovitch, Thomas E. Robinson, Michael J. Schall, Byron A. Scordelis, and Janice L. Sears.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the nominees is currently a director of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the nominees has consented, if elected as a director of the Company, to serve until his or her term expires.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that each such nominee will stand for election and will serve if elected as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, in the event that any nominee is unable or unwilling to serve as a director at the time of the Annual Meeting, the discretionary authority provided in the proxy will be exercised by the proxy holders to vote for a substitute or substitutes nominated by the Board, or the Board, on the recommendation of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee, may reduce the size of the Board and the number of nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain information about the director nominees is furnished below, highlighting each director nominees specific experience, qualifications, attributes and skills that led our Board to the conclusion that each should serve as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Keith R. Guericke, Director and Vice Chairman of the Essex Board, held the position of President and Chief Executive Officer of Essex from 1988 through 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective January 1, 2011, Mr. Guericke retired from his position as an executive officer, and he remains a director of Essex and continues to provide additional services as a part-time employee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Guericke joined Essexs predecessor, Essex Property Corporation, in 1977 to focus on investment strategies and portfolio expansion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Guericke prepared Essex for its IPO in 1994, and has since significantly increased Essexs multifamily portfolio in supply-constrained markets along the West Coast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Guericke serves on the board of directors of Century Communities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He also served on the board of directors of American Residential Properties, Inc. until February 2016 when it was sold.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is also a member of the National Association of Real Estate Investment Trusts (NAREIT) and several local apartment industry groups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining Essex, Mr. Guericke began his career with Kenneth Leventhal & Company, a CPA firm noted for its real estate expertise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Guericke received his Bachelor of Science degree in Accounting from Southern Oregon College in 1971.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board selected Mr. Guericke to serve as a director because he served Essex for over 34 years and was its principal executive officer from 1988 to 2010, and he has expansive knowledge of the real estate industry and strong relationships with many executives and other senior management at real estate companies throughout the United States.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Irving F. Lyons, III, Director, joined the Board in April 2014 pursuant to the Companys merger with BRE Properties, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He previously served as a director of BRE since 2006 and was appointed Chairman of the BRE board in May 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Lyons currently serves on the board of directors of Equinix, Inc. and is Lead Director of ProLogis, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He served as Vice Chairman of ProLogis, a global provider of distribution facilities and services, from 2001 through May 2006.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He was Chief Investment Officer of ProLogis from March 1997 to December 2004, and held several other executive positions since joining ProLogis in 1993.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining ProLogis, he was a Managing Partner of King & Lyons, a San Francisco Bay Area industrial real estate development and management company, since its inception in 1979.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board selected Mr. Lyons as a director due to his management and investment experience with publicly traded real estate companies and his involvement in Bay Area real estate development and management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: George M. Marcus is the founder and has been the Chairman of Essex Property Corporation (the predecessor to Essex) and the Marcus & Millichap Company since their inception in 1971.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Marcus & Millichap Company is the parent company of a diversified group of real estate service, investment and development firms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Marcus is also the Co-Chairman of Marcus & Millichap, Inc., referred to as MMI, and Mr. Marcus owns a controlling interest in MMI.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MMI is a national brokerage firm listed on the NYSE that underwent its initial public offering in 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Marcus was one of the original founders of Greater Bay Bancorp, a publicly held financial institution, which was acquired by Wells Fargo & Company in 2007.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Included among Mr. Marcus professional memberships are the Regent Emeritus of the University of California, the Real Estate Roundtable, the Policy Advisory Board of the University of California at BerkeleyCenter for Real Estate and Urban Economics, as well as numerous other professional and community organizations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He graduated with a Bachelor of Science degree in Economics from San Francisco State University.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He was honored as Alumnus of the Millennium in 1999 and received his honorary doctorate in 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Marcus is also a graduate of the Harvard Business School of Owners / Presidents Management Program and the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TABLE OF CONTENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Georgetown University Leadership Program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Essex Board selected Mr. Marcus to serve as a director because he is the founder of Essex, he brings outstanding leadership and vision to Essex, he has extensive knowledge of Essex, and over 40 years of experience working in the real estate industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Gary P. Martin, Director, is a private investor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He was the Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of Mobile Smart, a semiconductor company serving the automotive industry for the period from September 2000 to July 2002.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From April 1998 to August 2000, he served as Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of Halo Data Devices, a supplier of data storage products for the disk drive market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Martin served from August 1995 to January 1998 as Vice President of Finance and Chief Financial Officer of 3Dfx Interactive, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From September 1993 to July 1995, he served as Vice President of Finance and the Chief Financial Officer for MiniStor Peripherals Corporation, a supplier of data storage products for the mobile computer market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 1985 to 1993, he was Senior Vice President of Finance and Administration for Chips and Technologies, Inc., where he also developed joint business ventures within the Soviet Union.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 1983 to 1984, Mr. Martin was Vice President of Finance and Chief Financial Officer for Starstruck, Inc., a company involved in space development through private enterprise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Martin was one of the earliest employees at Apple Computer, Inc., where he held both corporate and European controller positions during the period from 1977 to 1983.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 1971 to 1977, he worked for Aero Air Freight and National Semiconductor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He received a Bachelor of Science degree in Accounting from San Jose State University in 1971.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board selected Mr. Martin to serve as a director because he has years of experience serving on both public and private boards and committees, he has served as a Chief Financial Officer for a variety of companies, and he has an extensive understanding of internal and external financial reporting of public companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Issie N. Rabinovitch, Director, is a partner at Cheyenne Capital, a venture capital firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He was the Chief Executive Officer of Mainsail Networks, a telecommunications company in 2000 and 2001.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining Cheyenne Capital, Mr. Rabinovitch served from 1991 to 1994 as President and Chief Executive Officer of Micro Power Systems, Inc., a company engaged in the designing, manufacturing and marketing of multiple semiconductor products.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 1985 to 1991, Mr. Rabinovitch was President of Berkeley International Capital Corporation, a venture capital firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 1983 to 1985, Mr. Rabinovitch was President of Crowntek Software International, a software development and distribution company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Before joining Crowntek, he was employed by the Xerox Corporation in various management roles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Rabinovitch received a Bachelor of Science degree from McGill University in 1967 and a Master of Business Administration degree from Harvard University in 1970.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board selected Mr. Rabinovitch to serve as a director because he brings valuable financial expertise, including extensive knowledge of capital markets transactions and investments in both public and private companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thomas E. Robinson, Director, joined the Board in April 2014 pursuant to the Companys merger with BRE Properties, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He previously served as a director for BRE since 2007.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, Mr. Robinson is Senior Advisor to the real estate investment banking group at Stifel, Nicolaus & Company, Inc., St. Louis, MO and its prior affiliate Legg Mason, where he was previously a managing director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to that position he served as President and Chief Financial Officer of Storage USA, Inc., from 1994 to 1997.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Robinson currently serves on the board of directors of First Potomac Realty Trust and Tanger Factory Outlet Centers, Inc., is a former trustee/director of Centerpoint Properties Trust and Legg Mason Real Estate Investors, Inc., and a past member of the board of governors of NAREIT.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board selected Mr. Robinson as a director due to his financial, accounting and real estate experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Michael J. Schall, Director, is the President and Chief Executive Officer of the Company, having been promoted to that position by the Board effective January 1, 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He previously served as the Senior Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer for the Company from 2005 to 2010, during which years he was responsible for the strategic planning and management of the Companys property operations, redevelopment and co-investment programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 1993 to 2005, Mr. Schall was the Companys Chief Financial Officer, responsible for the organizations financial and administrative matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He joined The Marcus & Millichap Company in 1986.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He was also the Chief Financial Officer of the Companys predecessor, Essex Property Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 1982 to 1986, Mr. Schall was the Director of Finance for Churchill International, a technology-oriented venture capital company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 1979 to 1982, Mr. Schall was employed in the audit department of Ernst & Young (then known as Ernst & Whinney), where he specialized in the real estate and financial services industries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Schall received a Bachelor of Science degree from the University of San Francisco.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Schall currently serves as a member of the Board of Trustees of Pebblebrook Hotel Trust, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Schall is a Certified Public Accountant (inactive) and is a member of NAREIT, the National Multi Housing Council, the AICPA, and the Executive Board of Governors of NAREIT.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TABLE OF CONTENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board selected Mr. Schall to serve as a director because he was a principal officer of the Company when initially selected as a director, he has extensive knowledge of the financial and operating matters of the Company, and he has strong relationships with many executives and senior management at real estate companies throughout the United States.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Byron A. Scordelis, Director, served as the President and Chief Executive Officer of Greater Bay Bancorp and as a member of the board of directors of Greater Bay Bancorp and its wholly-owned subsidiary, Greater Bay Bank N.A. from January 2004 until its sale in October 2007.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Scordelis served as the Chief Operating Officer and President of the Greater Bay Banking Group which was comprised of that companys banking subsidiaries as well as its business and technology operations, trust services and human resources activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Scordelis has previously served as an Executive Vice President with Wells Fargo Bank, where he was named President of the San Francisco Bay Area Region and was responsible for the management and performance of 235 financial service offices in the San Francisco Bay Area.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He joined Wells Fargo in 1998 as an Executive Vice President responsible for its retail banking activities in seven western states, and was appointed as a co-chair of its integration task force following the banks merger with Norwest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 1974 to 1998, Mr. Scordelis was President and Chief Executive Officer of EurekaBank and also served as Senior Vice President and head of Bank of Americas San Francisco Bay Area region, and was responsible for corporate finance, corporate strategic planning, merger integration, and other staff and managerial areas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Scordelis is a Phi Beta Kappa graduate of the University of California at Berkeley where he earned bachelors degrees in economics and natural resource studies in 1972.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He received a Master of Business Administration from Stanford University in 1974.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Scordelis currently serves on the Board of Regents at Santa Clara University where he is also a member of its Audit Committee as well as on the Advisory Board of the Markkula Center for Applied Ethics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is also a former member of the Board of EHC Lifebuilders, a non-profit organization, and served on the Advisory Board of the Palo Alto Medical Foundation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board selected Mr. Scordelis to serve as a director because of his many years of experience as a Chief Executive Officer and a board member of a publicly-traded financial service company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Janice L. Sears, Director, serves as Board Chair of The Swig Company, a corporate owner of office properties nationwide, and serves on the board of directors of Invitation Homes, a Blackstone Real Estate sponsored company which became publicly traded in February 2017 through an initial public offering.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Sears served as past director and Audit Committee Chair of BioMed Realty Trust, Inc. from 2014 until it was sold to affiliates of Blackstone Real Estate in January 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Previously, Ms. Sears held the position of Managing Director, Western Region Head in the Real Estate, Gaming & Lodging Investment Banking Group at Banc of America Securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She was concurrently the San Francisco Market President for Bank of America.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to 1999, Ms. Sears was Head of Client Management for Bank of Americas Commercial Real Estate Group in California, where she oversaw client relationships with REITs, homebuilders and opportunity funds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to 1988, Ms. Sears was a Real Estate Economist at both Chemical Bank and Citicorp in New York.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Her professional activities have included NAREIT, Urban Land Institute (ULI), and the National Association of Corporate Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Sears is the Past President and Past Treasurer of the San Francisco Chapter of the National Charity League and most recently sat on the boards of the San Francisco Chamber of Commerce, the San Francisco Economic Development Council and Leadership San Francisco.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She acts as an advisor to the Audit Committee of the San Francisco Art Institute.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Sears has been named one of the 100 Most Powerful Women in Business in San Francisco multiple times.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board selected Ms. Sears to serve as a director because of her knowledge of capital markets and extensive experience working in the commercial real estate and REIT industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board unanimously recommends that the stockholders vote FOR the election of all nominees named above.

sentences.text: The Audit Committee recommends the appointment of an independent registered public accounting firm to audit the financial statements of the Company for the fiscal year for which they are appointed, reviews audit reports and takes such action as may be deemed appropriate with respect to such audit reports.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also monitors the effectiveness of the audit effort, the Companys financial and accounting organization and its system of internal controls over financial reporting, and it reviews any allegations of wrongdoing that involve Company personnel.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that all Audit Committee members have no financial or personal ties to the Company (other than the director compensation and equity ownership as described in this proxy statement) and meet the NYSE standard for independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Board has determined that all members of the Audit Committee are financially literate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee establishes and reviews annually the Companys general compensation policies applicable to the Companys executive officers, reviews and approves the level of compensation of the CEO and other executive officers of the Company, reviews and advises the Board concerning the performance of the CEO and other employees whose compensation is within the review jurisdiction of the Compensation Committee, reviews and advises the Board concerning regional and industry-wide compensation practices and trends, and recommends benefit plans from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also administers the Companys 2013 Stock Award and Incentive Compensation Plan (the Incentive Award Plan).

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee met two times during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee will consider and make recommendations to the Board regarding any stockholder recommendations for candidates to serve on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, it has not adopted a formal process for that consideration because it believes that the informal consideration process has been adequate, given the historical absence of stockholder proposals, among other considerations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee will review periodically whether a more formal policy should be adopted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders wishing to recommend candidates for consideration by the Nominating Committee may do so by writing at least 120 days prior to the next annual meeting to assure time for meaningful consideration by the Nominating Committee to Jordan E. Ritter, Corporate Secretary, Essex Property Trust, Inc., 1100 Park Place, Suite 200, San Mateo, California 94403, providing the candidates name, biographical
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TABLE OF CONTENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: data and qualifications, a document indicating the candidates willingness to act if elected, and evidence of the nominating stockholders ownership of the Companys stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee evaluates nominees for directors using the criteria described below, and it will use the same criteria when evaluating a nominee recommended by a stockholder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee does not have a formal policy regarding considering diversity in identifying nominees for directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the past, when new directors have been added to the Board, the Board or the Nominating Committee has generally sought to select nominees with business specializations, technical skills or other qualities that differed from that of the existing directors and, as a result, the current directors on the Board have a diverse range of backgrounds and occupations, including real estate, financial services, accounting and finance, venture capital, and investment banking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee operates under a written charter setting forth the functions and responsibilities of the committee, which can be viewed at the Companys website at http://www.essex.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In reviewing potential candidates for the Board, the Nominating Committee considers the individuals real estate experience, along with experience in business, finance, administration and/or corporate governance, including as a current or former officer, board member or senior executive of a publicly held company, the needs of the Company for an additional or replacement director, the personality of the candidate, the candidates interest in the business of the Company, the diversity (including with respect to gender, age, race, culture and geography) that the candidate would bring to the Board, as well as numerous other subjective criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Of greatest importance is the individuals integrity, willingness to get involved and ability to bring to the Company experience and knowledge in areas that are most beneficial to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board intends to continue to evaluate candidates for election to the Board on the basis of the foregoing criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee further reviews current trends and practices in corporate governance and recommends to the Board the adoption of programs pertinent to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Presiding Independent Director; Board Leadership Structure and Role in Risk Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has designated, in accordance with NYSE corporate governance listing standards, Irving F. Lyons, III as the presiding independent director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys non-management directors meet at regularly scheduled executive sessions, without management, at which Mr. Lyons presides.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has maintained a leadership structure of different individuals serving as Chairman and Chief Executive Officer since its initial public offering in 1994 in recognition of the differences between the two roles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman is Mr. Marcus, who is a founder of the Company and has a significant ownership interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Marcus has extensive knowledge of the Company and the real estate industry, and the Company believes that because of his background and experience he is able to effectively lead the Board in providing oversight and direction to the Companys management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Marcus is involved in many other business and philanthropic activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Schalls responsibility as the Chief Executive Officer is to oversee the day to day execution of the Companys business strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This separation of the roles of Chairman and Chief Executive Officer allows for greater oversight of the Company by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that the Companys Board leadership structure is the most appropriate at this time, given the specific characteristics and circumstances of the Company, and the unique skills and experience of each of Mr. Marcus and Mr. Schall.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to the Boards role in the risk oversight of the Company, the Board has promulgated internal Company policies that set forth which transactions may require the prior approval of the Board or a committee of the Board and which transactions may proceed with management authorization and without any such Board prior approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These Board policies cover transactions in the following areas: financings, property acquisition, property development, property redevelopment, property dispositions, other investments and general corporate activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, these policies set forth a specified dollar threshold and if a transaction exceeds that threshold, the prior approval of the Board or a committee of the Board is required.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By requiring the prior approval of larger transactions, which generally may involve more risk to the Company simply due to the transaction size, the Board seeks to provide risk oversight of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has promulgated a corporate investment policy that establishes guidelines with respect to investment of the Companys funds; such guidelines cover the required qualifications of outside investment managers and the types and concentration limits of investment securities that are authorized for investment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has determined that the pay policies and practices of the Company are not reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also, related party transactions are generally
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TABLE OF CONTENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviewed by the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Certain Relationships and Related Person Transactions  Policies and Procedures with Respect to Related Person Transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under independence standards established by the Board, which reflect the NYSE director independence standards as currently in effect, a director does not qualify as independent unless the Board affirmatively determines that the director has no material relationship with the Company, either directly or as a partner, stockholder or officer of an organization that has a relationship with the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board considers such facts and circumstances as it deems relevant to the determination of director independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that the following directors and nominees for director have no material relationship with the Company (either directly or as a partner, stockholder or officer of an organization that has a relationship with the Company), and each is independent within the meaning of independence as set forth in the rules of the NYSE: Irving F. Lyons, III, George M. Marcus, Gary P. Martin, Issie N. Rabinovitch, Thomas E. Robinson, Byron A. Scordelis and Janice L. Sears.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining the independence of Mr. Marcus, the Board considered the matters that refer to Mr. Marcus set forth under Certain Relationships and Related Person Transactions below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining the independence of Mr. Martin, the Board considered that his adult son is employed by Essex at a junior level position and is not an executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also considered the directors ownership of Essex equity securities and determined, in accordance with principles of the NYSE listing standards, that such ownership is not inconsistent with a determination of independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Tenure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board regularly addresses director succession and reviews the mix of Board composition, diversity and experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes it is desirable to maintain a mix of longer-tenured, experienced directors and newer directors with fresh perspectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In furtherance of this objective, the Board nominated Mr. Lyons and Mr. Robinson as directors in 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is also mindful that director tenure can be relevant to the Boards performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this regard, the Board consists of longer-serving directors with significant experience and institutional knowledge who bring critical skills to the boardroom.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such longer-serving directors have a deep understanding of the Companys business and strategy, provide historical context in Board deliberations, and enhance Board dynamics and the Boards relationship with management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, the Board believes that Messrs. Marcus, Guericke and Schall, who have held various positions of senior leadership in the Company since its initial public offering in 1994, are a significant strength of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under their combined leadership, the Company has generated one of the highest total returns in the REIT industry over that period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, while director tenure is taken into consideration when making nomination decisions, the Board believes that imposing limits on director tenure would unnecessarily deprive it of the valuable contributions of its most experienced members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Evaluations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board conducts an annual review consisting of a self-evaluation process undertaken by the Nominating Committee to determine whether the Board and its committees are functioning effectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee receives comments from all directors and reports to the Board with a complete assessment of the Boards performance, focusing on identifying areas in which the Board or senior management believes a better contribution may be made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the review is to increase the effectiveness of the Board, and the results are reviewed with the full Board and its committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Stock Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company encourages its independent directors to own shares of the Companys stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In furtherance of this policy, the Company adopted guidelines setting a goal for each independent director to own a number of shares of the Companys stock equal in value to five times such directors annual cash retainer, in each case, as in effect as of, and based on the Companys stock price as of, January 1, 2010, or such later date that a director joined the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are expected to achieve this goal within four years of January 1, 2010 or, with respect to new directors, within four years of joining the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board or the Nominating Committee may waive this requirement or modify this guideline under certain circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, all independent directors were n compliance with the share ownership guideline.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company encourages its executive officers to own shares of the Companys stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In furtherance of this policy, the Company adopted guidelines setting a goal for executive officers to own a number of shares of the Companys stock equal in value to, with respect to the Chief Executive Officer, five times such individuals annual base salary, and, with respect to the Companys other executive officers, four times such individuals annual base salary, in each case, as in effect as of, and based on the Companys stock price as of, February 10, 2011, or such later date that an individual becomes an executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive officers are expected to achieve this goal within five years of March 1, 2011 or, with respect to new executive officers, within five years of becoming an executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board or the Nominating Committee may waive this requirement or modify this guideline under certain circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, all executive officers were in compliance with the share ownership guideline.

sentences.text: RISK ASSESSMENT IN COMPENSATION POLICIES AND PRACTICES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee, with the assistance of Company management, regularly considers the Companys compensation policies and practices to assess whether they encourage unnecessary or excessive risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Compensation Committee considered, among other factors, the following risk-mitigating features of the Companys compensation programs:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) a balanced mix of short- and long-term compensation (including equity-based compensation);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) performance goals and objectives that avoid excessive weight on a single performance measure;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) minimum stock ownership guidelines, which ensure that executive officers have a meaningful direct ownership stake in the Company and align executive officers with long-term stockholder interests; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) restrictions on engaging in hedging transactions in the Companys securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this assessment, the Company believes that its compensation policies and practices do not present risks that are reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TABLE OF CONTENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DIRECTOR COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, each non-employee director of Essex receives the following compensation under Essexs current director compensation program:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An annual equity grant with a grant value equal to $60,000 for directors (other than the Chairman) and $170,000 for the Chairman of the Board, determined using either the Black-Scholes or Monte Carlo pricing methodology.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors elect whether to receive such grant in the form of options or a stock award, or a combination of these types of awards, and must make this election at the time of Essexs annual meeting, at which time such grant of options and/or stock awards will be made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such annual grants of options and/or stock awards are fully vested on the grant date, but the shares subject to such awards are subject to a one-year transfer restriction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An annual cash retainer, paid quarterly, in the amount of $36,000 per year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A Board attendance fee of $1,200 per meeting attended.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A committee attendance fee of up to $1,000 per meeting, except as to regularly scheduled Audit Committee meetings, for which a $2,400 attendance fee is paid, and unanimous written consents, in lieu of committee meetings, for which a $500 participation fee is paid.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A committee chairman fee of $5,000 per year, except that the chairman of the Audit Committee receives $18,000 per year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each non-employee director, upon joining the Board, receives an automatic grant of options for that number of shares having a grant value equal to $80,000 using the Black-Scholes option pricing methodology.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such options become exercisable as to one-third of the shares of Common Stock subject to the option on each yearly anniversary of the grant date, such that the options granted will be fully exercisable three years after the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Compensation Discussion and Analysis discusses the compensation policies and programs for our named executive officers, which consist of our Chief Executive Officer, our Chief Financial Officer and our three other most highly compensated executive officers, as determined under the SECs executive compensation disclosure rules, for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table identifies our named executive officers and their positions in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

Zimmerman Co-Chief Investment Officer and Executive Vice President John D. Eudy Co-Chief Investment Officer and Executive Vice President

sentences.text: Executive Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary objectives of Essexs named executive officer compensation program are to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) attract, motivate and retain experienced, effective executives,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) direct the performance of those executives with clearly defined goals and measures of achievement, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) align the interests of management with the interests of Essexs stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With regard to absolute levels of executive compensation and Essexs named executive officer compensation program, the Compensation Committee periodically reviews relevant information about competitive pay levels and structures but also considers a number of other factors, as described in further detail in this Compensation Discussion and Analysis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the Board sets annual corporate goals that are generally designed to promote stockholder value creation over a multiple year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These corporate goals are used as the basis for measuring management performance, a key consideration in granting both short-term cash bonuses and long-term equity-linked or equity-based incentive awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These goals, which include measures of performance on both an absolute basis as well as relative to peers, are described in more detail in the discussion below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Goals for 2016 included:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: specific company performance metrics such as per share growth in FFO;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: yields from recent investment transactions relative to the pro-forma underwriting;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: same-property NOI growth:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: achieving Board approved business plan; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: dispositions of select assets and other discretionary objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Operating and Core FFO growth: In 2016, Essex had same-property revenue growth of 6.7%, and NOI growth of 8.1%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the year, Core Funds from Operations (Core FFO) per diluted share grew 12.4%, the sixth consecutive year of double digit growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Investments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Acquired ownership interests in four apartment communities, located in urban and suburban neighborhoods in proximity to public transit systems, for $334 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Made preferred equity investments in five joint-ventures, for $116 million and originated two mezzanine loans, for $24 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In development, we completed the lease-up of three communities comprising 421 units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Redevelopment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Expanded our redevelopment and resource management platforms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through these programs, we seek to improve the quality of our communities based on consumer needs and expectations, while earning an attractive return on investment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Furthermore, our resource management efforts implement sustainable practices to conserve water and reduce energy consumption at our existing communities, decreasing our impact on the environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Portfolio Management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Opportunistically sold $228 million of apartment communities at attractive pricing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Balance Sheet Management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Achieved a Debt, net of deferred financing costs, premiums and discounts, to Total Market Capitalization (defined as total debt, net of deferred financing costs, premiums and discounts plus total equity capitalization) ratio of 26.0% at year-end and obtained upgrades by S&P and Moodys to BBB+/Baa1.

sentences.text: Pay for Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee views pay for performance as an important component of Essexs named executive officer compensation philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considered Essexs performance in 2016 in determining levels of named executive officer compensation, including short- and long-term incentive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation of Essexs named executive officers also reflects performance against individual and (where appropriate) business unit goals, as described in further detail in the discussion below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Policies and PracticesGood Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with our commitment to strong corporate governance and responsiveness to our stockholders, in 2016 our Board maintained the following compensation policies and practices to drive performance and serve our stockholders long-term interests:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The structure of our named executive officer compensation program includes a balanced mix of cash and equity compensation with a strong emphasis on performance-based incentive awards promoting responsible growth and risk management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The competitiveness of our named executive officer compensation program is assessed by comparison to the median of a group of peer companies that are comparable to us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee is comprised solely of independent directors and annually engages an independent compensation consultant to advise on matters related to our named executive officer compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have not entered into individual employment agreements with our named executive officers, and we do not provide our named executive officers with tax gross-ups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain meaningful stock ownership guidelines for our named executive officers and non-employee directors that promote a long-term stockholder perspective.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee annually considers and assesses the potential risks of our compensation policies and practices for all employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our named executive officers receive limited perquisites and other personal benefits that are not otherwise generally available to all of our employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain programs that limit the ability of our named executive officers and non-employee directors to pledge or hedge our securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Stockholder Advisory Vote on Named Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We currently submit an advisory vote to approve our named executive officer compensation to our stockholders on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2016 annual meeting, holders of approximately 96.3% of the votes cast voted for the advisory proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe the continued support for our compensation program in 2016 reflects the strong alignment between our named executive officer compensation and performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considered the results of the stockholder vote in continuing to apply the same principles in determining the amounts and types of executive compensation and did not implement substantial changes as a result of the stockholder advisory vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TABLE OF CONTENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overview of Named Executive Officer Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key Named Executive Officer Compensation Program Objectives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The objectives of our compensation program for named executive officers are to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attract, retain, and motivate executive officers through the overall design and mix of cash, equity, and short- and long-term compensation elements;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reward individual performance by tying significant portions of short-term compensation in the form of salary and annual bonus opportunity to achievement of individual performance; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Align the interests of executive officers with the interests of Essexs stockholders by tying significant portions of short- and long-term compensation, in the form of annual bonus and long-term equity based awards, to increasing distributable cash flow to stockholders, and increasing the value of Common Stock based on the acquisition, development, redevelopment and onsite property management of apartment communities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Within these objectives, the Compensation Committee believes that the primary goal of Essexs named executive officer compensation program should be related to creating stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee seeks to offer the named executive officers competitive compensation opportunities based upon their personal performance, the financial performance of Essex as compared to other REITs, and their contribution to that performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How Executive Compensation Decisions are Made
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role and Procedures of the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee, composed of independent, non-employee directors, determines and approves the compensation arrangements for the named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has the authority to select, retain and terminate special counsel and other experts (including compensation consultants) as the Committee deems appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal year 2016, the Compensation Committee retained Mercer as its compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mercer has not provided any services to Essex other than to the Compensation Committee with respect to executive and Board compensation matters, reports directly to the Compensation Committee and not to management, and is independent from Essex.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has assessed the independence of Mercer pursuant to, and taking into account factors listed in, applicable SEC and stock exchange rules and concluded that the work of Mercer has not raised any conflict of interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Compensation Committee determines Essexs overall compensation philosophy and sets the compensation for Essexs CEO and other executive officers, it looks to the CEO to make recommendations with respect to both overall compensation policies and specific compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the upcoming fiscal year, Essexs CEO recommends to the Compensation Committee the levels of base salary, targeted annual bonus and long-term equity for the named executive officers other than himself, within the elements of compensation otherwise established by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The sum of such base salaries and targeted bonuses and long term equity compensation, if any, is included in the Essex annual business plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also, at that time, the Compensation Committee reviews and approves goals for the upcoming year for specific executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such goals may include company-wide, business unit and individual goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the end of a fiscal year, the Compensation Committee reviews actual performance against goals and, in consultation with the CEO and as discussed further below, sets the actual bonuses to be paid to the executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO also provides the Compensation Committee with his perspective on the performance of Essexs executive officers as well as a self-assessment of his own performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee establishes the compensation package for the CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Essexs Chief Financial Officer also attends certain of the Compensation Committees meetings to provide perspective on the competitive landscape and the needs of the business and to discuss potentially new elements for the executive officers compensation packages.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key Elements of Named Executive Officer Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The key elements of Essexs current compensation program for the named executive officers are summarized in the table below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation element Why this element is included How the amount of the element is determined How the element fits in the overall program Base Salary Fixed base pay necessary to attract and retain executives and compensate performance of core job duties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salary and any changes in salary are based on views of individual retention or performance factors and market data at peer companies (but without specific benchmarking).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Short-term cash compensation that is fixed and paid during the year, addresses employee cash- flow needs and retention objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Cash Bonus Variable cash compensation that motivates executives and ties a significant compensation opportunity to achieving individual and corporate performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual bonus is based on both discretionary and non- discretionary performance criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Short-term cash compensation that is contingent on achievement of Company and individual goals, as determined by the Compensation Committee, is intended to link compensation to short-term stockholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Equity Incentive Equity compensation (in the form of restricted stock units (RSUs) and options) fosters long-term retention of management and aligns executive officer and stockholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term equity incentive awards are determined primarily based on how the awards grant date value relates to the executive officers total cash compensation and how the vesting and other aspects of the award might incentivize performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity compensation complements cash compensation and provides performance incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RSUs may be subject to both performance-based and service-based vesting or performance-based vesting only.
